div.p: McCreary County has various departments to serve your needs. Take a look below to find out more information about each of them.

article.class: post-66 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry

div.p: Scenic McCreary County, Kentucky is located in southeastern Kentucky on the southern edge of the Daniel Boone National Forest and the northern end of the Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area (NRRA). This area is known for its abundant scenic beauty, outdoor recreational opportunities and its history and heritage. McCreary County is home to Natural Arch, Historic Stearns/Stearns Trail Town, Barthell Coal Mining Camp, a section of the Sheltowee Trace National Recreation Trail and so much more!

Scenic McCreary County, Kentucky is located in southeastern Kentucky on the southern edge of the Daniel Boone National Forest and the northern end of the Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area (NRRA). This area is known for its abundant scenic beauty, outdoor recreational opportunities and its history and heritage.
